oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cross country travelers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Transportation
African American men; African American women; Automobiles
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Five African Americans posing in and next to an early automobile, in front of Jarnigan & Son Undertakers. The open running board on the driver's side is being used for stowage, and three persons, two men and one woman, wearing jodphurs, boots, and hats stand next to the car. The male driver and a female passenger in the back seat are also wearing hats. The car's windshield is covered with decals.

Pictured left to right are: Walter Kennedy, Thurman Amerine, Mrs. A.A. Fielding, Miss Maude Fielding, and Alonzo A. Fielding. According to historian Robert J. Booker, this group traveled to tourist attractions across the western United States, circa 1914.
